Class GameServer

java.lang.Object
edu.io.net.server.GameServer
public class GameServer extends Object
High-level game server coordinating domain-level game logic and handling game-related commands delivered through a lower-level TCPServer.

The server acts as the domain layer of the architecture. It does not manage sockets directly; instead it delegates all transport responsibilities—such as accepting connections, receiving commands and sending responses—to TCPServer.

Responsibilities

  • maintaining the Game instance and executing game logic,
  • registering handlers for all supported command types,
  • processing commands in a per-client context,
  • sending responses or broadcasting game state updates,
  • validating protocol versions and command correctness.

Threading model

All command handlers run on virtual threads created by TCPServer, one per connected client. Game state may therefore be modified concurrently and must be thread-safe.

State synchronization

Handlers may broadcast Command instances (such as game state updates) using TCPServer.broadcast(Command) to keep all clients synchronized.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameServer

      public GameServer(int port)
      Creates a new game server instance bound to the given TCP port.

      The constructor initializes:

      • a TCPServer responsible for transport-level handling,
      • command routing via setupCommandRouter().

      A game instance is not created here; it must be provided through assignGame(Game) before calling start().

      Parameters:
      port - TCP port on which the server will listen for client connections

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Entry point for running the server as a standalone application.

      Creates a new GameServer bound to port 1313, assigns a fresh Game instance, and starts the server. The server begins accepting TCP connections and dispatching incoming commands to registered handlers.

      Parameters:
      args - command-line arguments (currently unused)

    • assignGame

      public GameServer assignGame(Game game)
      Assigns the Game instance used by this server.

      This method must be called before start() or before handling commands requiring game access.

      Parameters:
      game - non-null game instance
      Returns:
      this server instance for method chaining

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Starts the game logic using the currently assigned Game instance.

      This does not start the TCP subsystem; the transport layer is started by start().

    • start

      public GameServer start()
      Starts the underlying TCPServer, enabling client acceptance and command dispatch.

      The method attempts to start the TCP subsystem and propagates startup failures as a RuntimeException. Game logic should be initialized beforehand via assignGame(Game) and (optionally) startGame().

      Once running, the server processes incoming commands on virtual threads created per client connection.

      Returns:
      this server instance for method chaining
